revised_title: The Chemical Composition and Toxicity of Lotus arabicus Poison
tldr: The authors investigate the chemical composition and toxicity of the poison found in Lotus arabicus, discovering that the poisonous property is due to prussic acid formed when the plant is crushed with water. They also study the properties of lotoflavin and lotusin, as well as the enzyme lotase, in relation to other hydrolytic enzymes.
